item.title: Shannon add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy." -- Rumi

item.title: Shannon add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "The most wasted of all days is one without laughter." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
item.description: "Joy is the infallible sign of the presence of God." -- Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You are people with a present and with a future. Don't muff the ball. Be excellent." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "Christmas can be celebrated in the school room with pine trees, tinsel and reindeers, but there must be no mention of the man whose birthday is being celebrated. One wonders how a teacher would answer if a student asked why it was called Christmas." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Bob Hope
item.description: "When we recall Christmas past, we usually find that the simplest things - not the great occasions - give off the greatest glow of happiness." -- Bob Hope

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "A lovely thing about Christmas is that it's compulsory, like a thunderstorm, and we all go through it together." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Hamilton Wright Mabie
item.description: "Blessed is the season which engages the whole world in a conspiracy of love." -- Hamilton Wright Mabie

item.title: Shannon add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Shannon add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Summer will end soon enough, and childhood as well." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Shannon add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
